artist: Artist: Utagawa Hiroshige; Publisher: Wakasaya Yoichi
catalogue_raissonne: Ukiyo-e shūka 14 (1981), Hiroshige list, p. 241, ōtanzaku #8.6
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
Poem, by Hakuen: Yokkame no/ shishi itai geni/ botan ka na 四日めの　獅子いたいけに　牡丹哉　白猿 (A four-days old lion cub/ is little and fragile/ but as graceful as peony)

Dr. Hayashi did not know what yokkame (the forth day) refers to. 
\"Four-days old\" is Yuiko\'s guess.

*Lion and peony are frequently mentioned together because they both are the kings of their kinds. 
cf. Karajishi-botan

Dr. N. Hayashi, Oct. 2007
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
title: Lion Training Cub
